Main.TextJPN: 「………本当に５分だけですからね。@k@vS02/00/doc03002.刺激しないようにして下さい」
Main.TextENG: ``......Only for five minutes, understand?@k@vS02/00/doc03002. Please, try not to excite him.``

Main.TextJPN: 「えぇえぇ。心得ていますよ」
Main.TextENG: ``Yes, yes. I'll be careful.``

Main.TextJPN: ガチャリ。
Main.TextENG: Kaclack.

Main.TextJPN: 扉が開き、…思ったとおり、大石さんが入ってきた。
Main.TextENG: The door opened... and as I expected, Ooishi-san came in.

Main.TextJPN: 「どうもどうも前原さん。@k@vS02/11/130700394.ご無沙汰しておりますね。@k@vS02/11/130700395.その後、お加減はいかがですか」
Main.TextENG: ``Hello, hello, Maebara-san.@k@vS02/11/130700394. It's been a while, hasn't it?@k@vS02/11/130700395. Tell me, how have you been since then?``

Main.TextJPN: 「……医者が言うには術後の回復は順調だそうですが、…あんたの顔を見たらまた傷が悪くなりそうです」
Main.TextENG: ``...The doctor says my post-operative recovery seems to be going smoothly... but I think I got worse when I saw your face.``

Main.TextJPN: 「なっはっはっはっはっは！　こりゃあ手厳しい」
Main.TextENG: ``Nah-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha! You wound me.``

Main.TextJPN: 大石さんは汗臭い声で笑いながら、病院の１階のおみやげコーナーで買ってきたらしい菓子の詰め合わせをお袋に渡した。
Main.TextENG: As Ooishi-san gave a laugh that smelled of sweat, he handed Mom a bag of assorted candies he must have purchased from the souvenir corner on the first floor of the hospital.

Main.TextJPN: 「すみません、お母さん。@k@vS02/11/130700398.ほんのしばらく圭一くんとお話しする時間をいただいてもよろしいですか？」
Main.TextENG: ``Excuse me, Mrs. Maebara.@k@vS02/11/130700398. Would it be possible for me to talk to Keiichi-kun for just a few moments?``

Main.TextJPN: お袋は、警察が親抜きで息子と話をすることに不快感をあらわにした。
Main.TextENG: Mom clearly wasn't pleased at the thought of a police officer talking to her son without her there.

Main.TextJPN: ……だが、俺からも言う。
Main.TextENG: ...However, I insisted.
``......Mom.@k@vS02/01/130101188. Sorry, just a little while.@k@vS02/01/130101189. Just five minutes, okay?``

Main.TextJPN: お袋は渋々とだけど、退出してくれた。
Main.TextENG: Though grudgingly, Mom left the room.

Main.TextJPN: 扉がしまると、大石さんはにやーっと笑って病室内を見渡した。
Main.TextENG: When she closed the door, Ooishi-san grinned widely and looked around the room.

Main.TextJPN: 「個室なんていい身分ですねぇ！@k@vS02/11/130700400.　うちの婆さまなんか、いっつも相部屋ですよ？@k@vS02/11/130700401.　そりゃーもう賑やかなことで」
Main.TextENG: ``A room to yourself—how high class!@k@vS02/11/130700400. My old lady always gets a shared room, you know.@k@vS02/11/130700401. It is quite lively, however.``

Main.TextJPN: 「ああいうところじゃ、病気の重さがひとつのステータスになるらしいんですよ。@k@vS02/11/130700403.より重病な患者ほど偉いというか威張っているというか…」
Main.TextENG: ``Seems like you're a higher rank if you have a worse disease in places like that.@k@vS02/11/130700403. The sicker you are, the prouder you are—or maybe the more arrogant...``

Main.TextJPN: 「…大石さん、５分ですよ。@k@vS02/01/130101191.できればこれが本当に最後の５分にしてほしいものです」
Main.TextENG: ``...Ooishi-san, we only have five minutes.@k@vS02/01/130101191. I would like it if these were the last five minutes we ever saw each other.

Main.TextJPN: 「……俺はもう雛見沢とは関係ないし、…ここももう雛見沢じゃない」
Main.TextENG: ......I don't have any connection to Hinamizawa anymore... and this isn't in Hinamizawa anymore either.``

Main.TextJPN: 「……興宮には総合病院はありませんからねぇ。@k@vS02/11/130700405.…椅子、よろしいですかな？@k@vS02/11/130700406.　よっこらしょっと」
Main.TextENG: ``...Yes, because there aren't any general hospitals in Okinomiya.@k@vS02/11/130700405. ...Mind if I take a seat?@k@vS02/11/130700406. Down we go.``

Main.TextJPN: ここは鹿骨市内の大きな大学病院だ。
Main.TextENG: This was a large university hospital in Shishibone City.

Main.TextJPN: さすがに雛見沢や興宮なんかとは全然違って、立派な都会。
Main.TextENG: It was splendidly urban, entirely different from the likes of Hinamizawa and Okinomiya.

Main.TextJPN: あの雛見沢と、同じ市内にあるとはにわかには信じがたい。
Main.TextENG: It was hard to believe Hinamizawa was part of the same city.

Main.TextJPN: 「転院はいつ頃になりそうですか？」
Main.TextENG: ``When does it look like you'll get transferred?``

Main.TextJPN: 「さぁ。@k@vS02/01/130101194.…俺的にはいつでもＯＫなんですけどね」
Main.TextENG: ``Dunno.@k@vS02/01/130101194. ...I'm ready to go whenever, though.``

Main.TextJPN: 俺の大怪我のせいで引越しは少し遅れることになってしまった。
Main.TextENG: Our moving plans were delayed a little because of my serious injury.

Main.TextJPN: だが、すでに両親は雛見沢の家を出、新しい引越し先で生活しているという。
Main.TextENG: My parents had already left the house in Hinamizawa, though, and were living in our new one.

Main.TextJPN: 俺も、搬送が可能な状態にまで回復したら、引越し先の病院に転院する予定だ。
Main.TextENG: They planned to have me transfer hospitals to be closer to the new house once I'd recovered enough to be taken there.

Main.TextJPN: 「…転院先にまで来ないで下さいよ。@k@vS02/01/130101196.本当に具合が悪くなりますからね」
Main.TextENG: ``...Please, don't come to where I'm transferring.@k@vS02/01/130101196. I really will get worse then.``

Main.TextJPN: 「いやぁ…すっかり嫌われちゃいました。@k@vS02/11/130700409.仕事柄とは言え、心苦しいですよ。@k@vS02/11/130700410.なので、今日はこれまでの罪滅ぼしに素敵なおみやげをいろいろお持ちしましたので」
Main.TextENG: ``Man... You really do hate me.@k@vS02/11/130700409. It may just be my job, but that stings.@k@vS02/11/130700410. That's why I brought you all kinds of lovely souvenirs in atonement.``

Main.TextJPN: 「………別にクッキーの詰め合わせなんか持ってこなくっても」
Main.TextENG: ``......You didn't need to bring an assortment of cookies for that.``

Main.TextJPN: 「それがねぇ～。@k@vS02/11/130700412.実は中身はクッキーじゃないんですよ。@k@vS02/11/130700413.ほぅら～」
Main.TextENG: ``Well, you see...@k@vS02/11/130700412. There aren't actually cookies in there.@k@vS02/11/130700413. Look~``

Main.TextJPN: 大石さんがガパンとクッキーの缶を開けると……のわ？！@k　痛てて、手術跡が突っ張る…。
Main.TextENG: Ooishi-san pulls open the can of cookies, and ......Nwahh?!@k Ow, ow, I'm stretching my scar...

Main.TextJPN: 「前原さんの好みがわからなかったので、いろいろと持ってきましたよ～。@k@vS02/11/130700415.ほぅら、より取り見取り野原は黄緑～てなもんです。@k@vS02/11/130700416.さぁさ、好きなだけ持って行っちゃってくださいー！」
Main.TextENG: ``I didn't know what you were into, Maebara-san, so I brought all sorts of things~@k@vS02/11/130700415. See, all sorts of cute-looking ones, from Westerns to comic strips!@k@vS02/11/130700416. Take any you want~``

Main.TextJPN: 「こここ、こんな本なんか持ってこないで下さい～！！！@k@vS02/01/130101199.　持って帰って持って帰って！！@k@vS02/01/130101200.　痛ててててて…！！」
Main.TextENG: ``D-D-D-D-D-D-D-Don't bring porn in here~!!!@k@vS02/01/130101199. Take them away, and go home!!@k@vS02/01/130101200. Ow, ow ow ow ow...!!``

Main.TextJPN: 「んっふっふっふ！@k@vS02/11/130700418.　健全な若者がこんな所にずーーーっと閉じ込められてたら、さぞや御入用だと思ったんですけどねぇ。@k@vS02/11/130700419.こんなところにいると看護師フェチにしかなりませんよぅ？」
Main.TextENG: ``Nfu-fu-fu!@k@vS02/11/130700418. I thought for sure a healthy young person like you would be feeling a little needy, being cooped up in a place like this for sooooo long.@k@vS02/11/130700419. If you stay here too long, the only fetish you'll end up with is a nurse one, you know.``

Main.TextJPN: 「世の中には看護師さん以外にも素晴らしいものがいっぱいあるんですからねぇ！@k@vS02/11/130700421.　今から専門を決めないで、幅広く！@k@vS02/11/130700422.　オールラウンドに行かなくちゃ。@k@vS02/11/130700423.んっふっふっふっふっふ！！」
Main.TextENG: There are plenty of other beautiful things in this world besides nurses, after all!@k@vS02/11/130700421. Don't decide what to major in now—keep your options open!@k@vS02/11/130700422. You need to be a more all-around type of person.@k@vS02/11/130700423. Nfu-fu-fu-fu-fu-fu-fu-fu!!``

Main.TextJPN: 大石さんの下品な笑いに合わせて、俺も苦笑いを返す。
Main.TextENG: I gave Ooishi-san's vulgar laughter a pained grin.

Main.TextJPN: …でも、何となくわかっていた。
Main.TextENG: ...Somehow or other, I understood.

Main.TextJPN: 大石さんが、こんな切り出し方をするということは、……何か重要な話があるに違いないのだ。
Main.TextENG: The fact that Ooishi-san was bringing it up like this... meant that he must have had something important to talk about.

Main.TextJPN: 「……………詩音さんの件は本当にお気の毒でした」
Main.TextENG: ``............The incident with Shion-san really was unfortunate.``

Main.TextJPN: 俺が魅音に刺されたあの夜。
Main.TextENG: The night I was stabbed by Mion.

Main.TextJPN: 詩音はベランダから落ちて死んだ。
Main.TextENG: Shion fell from her balcony and died.

Main.TextJPN: …警察は事故、自殺、他殺の全ての可能性で調べる、なんて言っていたが、…魅音の仕業以外にはありえないのだ…。
Main.TextENG: ...They said the police were investigating all possibilities—accident, suicide, and homicide—but it could only have been Mion's doing...

Main.TextJPN: 魅音が、詩音の隠れ家を探り当て、……突き落として殺した。@kそれ以外に考えられない。
Main.TextENG: Mion found out where Shion was hiding... and pushed her down to her death.@k Nothing else was conceivable.
``............It couldn't have been an accident.@k@vS02/01/130101203. ......It was Mion.@k@vS02/01/130101204. ...It had to be.``

Main.TextJPN: 「………鑑識の連中は自殺だとしか思えないなんて言ってるんですが、私も前原さんと同じ意見です。@k@vS02/11/130700426.…詩音さんを突き落とし、さらにあなたを刺した。@k@vS02/11/130700427.…一晩の内にね」
Main.TextENG: ``......The criminology guys are saying it had to be a suicide, but I'm of the same opinion as you, Maebara-san.@k@vS02/11/130700426. ...She pushed Shion-san, and also stabbed you.@k@vS02/11/130700427. ...In one night.``

Main.TextJPN: 「…………………………魅音は、…まだ見つからないんですか」
Main.TextENG: ``............Has Mion... still not been found?``

Main.TextJPN: 「そうそう。@k@vS02/11/130700429.それを今日はお伝えしたくて来たんですよ。@k@vS02/11/130700430.…はい」
Main.TextENG: ``Oh, that's right.@k@vS02/11/130700429. That's what I came here to tell you today.@k@vS02/11/130700430. ...Yes.``

Main.TextJPN: 「実は見つかったんです」
Main.TextENG: ``We actually did find her.``

Main.TextJPN: …それは…何だか不思議な気持ちだった。
Main.TextENG: ...Learning that... felt rather strange to me.

Main.TextJPN: 事件が本当の意味で終わったという安堵感と、…親友がついに捕まったと言う気の毒な気持ちと。@k……他にも他にも…。@k……複雑な胸中だった。
Main.TextENG: I was partly relieved that the incident was truly over... and I was partly sorry that my best friend had finally been caught.@k ...I felt many other things, too...@k ...My heart was a maze of emotions.

Main.TextJPN: 「それだけじゃない。@k@vS02/11/130700433.園崎家の例の地下。@k@vS02/11/130700434.…隠し井戸も見つかったんですよ」
Main.TextENG: ``That's not all.@k@vS02/11/130700433. In the Sonozaki house catacombs.@k@vS02/11/130700434. ...We found a hidden well.

Main.TextJPN: 「前原さんが仰られてた通り、失踪者全員の遺体をその底で発見しました」
Main.TextENG: Just as you said, Maebara-san, we found the remains of all those who disappeared at the bottom.``

Main.TextJPN: …遺体が見つからないということだけを心の拠り所に、…今日まで信じてきた梨花ちゃんや沙都子の、……生きている可能性は、…潰えた。
Main.TextENG: ...That sliver of hope, that possibility I'd believed in... that Rika-chan and Satoko were alive... just from the fact their remains hadn't been found... gone.

Main.TextJPN: 「あの地下に、実に巧妙に隠されてましてね。@k@vS02/11/130700437.いやいや、まさに死角中の死角でした」
Main.TextENG: ``It was incredibly well-hidden in those catacombs.@k@vS02/11/130700437. I mean, it was in the blind spot of another blind spot.``

Main.TextJPN: 「井戸状に掘られた垂直トンネルでして。@k@vS02/11/130700439.…ハシゴが設けてあって、下へずーーっと行ったところに今度は横へ抜けるトンネルが作られていました」
Main.TextENG: ``It was a vertical tunnel, dug out like a well.@k@vS02/11/130700439. ...There was a ladder set up there, and when we went aaaaall the way down, there was another tunnel built there going through it.

Main.TextJPN: 「…そこを数百メートルも這って進むと、何と山中の古井戸に抜けられましてね」
Main.TextENG: ...When we followed it a few hundred meters, we found ourselves at the mouth of an old unused well in the mountains.``

Main.TextJPN: 「………過去の園崎家の当主が作らせた、秘密の逃げ道だったんでしょうね」
Main.TextENG: ``......I wonder if it was a secret escape route a previous Sonozaki family leader built.``

Main.TextJPN: 「でしょうなぁ。@k@vS02/11/130700442.…明治以降に作ったものでしょうが。@k@vS02/11/130700443.いやいや、…よくもあんなものを作ったもんです」
Main.TextENG: ``Probably was.@k@vS02/11/130700442. ...Maybe it was made in the Meiji era.@k@vS02/11/130700443. Still... I'm impressed they built something like that.``

Main.TextJPN: 「……………みんなの遺体は、………その底に…？」
Main.TextENG: ``.........So everyone's remains...... were at the bottom...?``

Main.TextJPN: 「はい。@k@vS02/11/130700445.…逃げ道の通路よりもさらに下に、コールタール状の泥水が溜まってまして。@k@vS02/11/130700446.そこに無造作に投げ込まれていました」
Main.TextENG: ``Yes.@k@vS02/11/130700445. ...Even deeper down than the escape path, there was a pool of coal tar.@k@vS02/11/130700446. They'd been casually thrown into there.

Main.TextJPN: 「相当の高さから落としたわけですから、遺体はどっぷりと埋まってしまってましてね。@k@vS02/11/130700448.…遺体の引き上げにはだいぶ苦労させられました」
Main.TextENG: They had fallen from a fairly high spot, so their remains were totally buried in it.@k@vS02/11/130700448. ...It took a lot of time and effort to pull their bodies up.``

Main.TextJPN: 「………………………………全員、見つかりましたか」
Main.TextENG: ``............Did you... find them all?``

Main.TextJPN: 梨花ちゃんと沙都子だけは、…見つからないでほしい。
Main.TextENG: I hoped... that they at least wouldn't find Rika-chan or Satoko.

Main.TextJPN: …そんな願いをこめたつもりだったが、その淡い願いはあっという間に打ち砕かれた。
Main.TextENG: ...That's what I wished for when I asked, but my shallow hope was crushed in the blink of an eye.

Main.TextJPN: 「はい。@k@vS02/11/130700450.全員。@k@vS02/11/130700451.……それどころか、死後１０年以上経過したと思われる人骨も見つかりました。@k@vS02/11/130700452.最低でも３人分はあると思われます。@k@vS02/11/130700453.……雛見沢の歴史の暗部というわけでしょうなぁ」
Main.TextENG: ``Yes.@k@vS02/11/130700450. All of them.@k@vS02/11/130700451. ...In fact, we also found human bones we think are over a decade old.@k@vS02/11/130700452. We think there are at least three people.@k@vS02/11/130700453. ...I suppose it's the dark side of Hinamizawa's history.

Main.TextJPN: 「泥を全部吸い出したら、…一体何人分の骨が出てくるやら。@k@vS02/11/130700455.……怖い話です」
Main.TextENG: I wonder how many people's bones... we'll find when we've sucked out all the mud.@k@vS02/11/130700455. ...It's a scary thought.``

Main.TextJPN: ………………その重さは、そのまま魅音の肩に圧し掛かっていた重さなのだ。
Main.TextENG: ............That weight had been pushing down on Mion's shoulders the whole time.

Main.TextJPN: 「…今、鹿骨市内の過去数十年の失踪者を洗いなおしているところです。@k@vS02/11/130700457.…諦められてた失踪事件も、これを機にぜーんぶ解決するんじゃないかなんて言われてますよ」
Main.TextENG: ``...We've currently identified people who disappeared from Shishibone City decades ago.@k@vS02/11/130700457. ...People are talking about how this opportunity might let us resolve the disappearing persons cases that have been abandoned.``

Main.TextJPN: 深い沈黙に……重いため息を漏らす…。
Main.TextENG: After a deep silence...... he breathed a heavy sigh...

Main.TextJPN: 大石さんがタバコで間を持たそうとしたが、禁煙場所であることに気付き、諦めて胸ポケにしまった。
Main.TextENG: Ooishi-san went for his cigarettes to pass the time, but realized this was a non-smoking area, so he gave up and put them back in his shirt pocket.

Main.TextJPN: 「そうそう。@k@vS02/11/130700459.…これは寄り道なんですが、@k@vS02/11/130700460.………古手梨花さん、ご存じですよね？」
Main.TextENG: ``Oh, right.@k@vS02/11/130700459. ...This is a bit of a detour......@k@vS02/11/130700460. but you know Rika Furude-san, right?``
``Of course.@k@vS02/01/130101214. ...She's my friend.``

Main.TextJPN: 「彼女、たとえば糖尿病でインスリンの注射を常用していたとか、そんな話はありました？」
Main.TextENG: ``Did she ever tell you anything along the lines of her regularly taking insulin injections for diabetes?``

Main.TextJPN: ……………？？@k　梨花ちゃんが糖尿病？？？@k　何の話だかわからない。
Main.TextENG: ..........??@k Rika-chan has diabetes???@k I didn't know what he was talking about.

Main.TextJPN: 「実は、彼女のスカートのポッケからですね」
Main.TextENG: ``Actually, we found it in her skirt pocket.``

Main.TextJPN: 「注射器が見つかりまして。@k@vS02/11/130700464.破損していたので、薬物は特定できなかったのですが。@k@vS02/11/130700465.……少々不似合いだったので、興味を持ちまして。@k@vS02/11/130700466.……本当にご存じありません？」
Main.TextENG: ``A syringe.@k@vS02/11/130700464. It was destroyed, though, so we couldn't identify the medicine.@k@vS02/11/130700465. ...It was a bit out of place, so I got interested.@k@vS02/11/130700466. ...You really don't know anything?``

Main.TextJPN: ……梨花ちゃんが注射器を持ち歩いていたなんて話は知らない。
Main.TextENG: ......I didn't know anything about Rika-chan carrying syringes around with her.

Main.TextJPN: 園崎家には、色々と黒い噂がまことしやかに囁かれていた。……その中に、非合法の密売を行っている、などと根も葉もないデマもあった。
Main.TextENG: There were various dark rumors relating to the Sonozaki family. ...Among them, there was even baseless speculation that they were selling illegal contraband.

Main.TextJPN: ……だとしたら梨花ちゃんも、それに関わっている疑いがある、とでも言いたいのか……？！
Main.TextENG: ...Did Ooishi mean to say that Rika-chan is also suspected in relation to such things?!

Main.TextJPN: 「いえいえ…そうは申してませんよ」
Main.TextENG: ``No, not at all... That isn't what I'm saying.``

Main.TextJPN: 「…ただ、お醤油をもらいに行くついでに注射器を持っていくってのは、…どう考えても変ですからねぇ」
Main.TextENG: ``...It just seems strange however you look at it... that she would bring a syringe with her on her way to get soy sauce.``

Main.TextJPN: ……………………何が何やら……わけがわからない。
Main.TextENG: ............I have no idea... what any of this means.

Main.TextJPN: 目が回る…。@k…吐き気が……………。
Main.TextENG: My eyes are spinning...@k ...I feel sick..............

Main.TextJPN: 「大丈夫ですか？@k@vS02/11/130700473.　看護師さんを呼びましょうか？」
Main.TextENG: ``Are you all right?@k@vS02/11/130700473. Should I call a nurse?``
``I... I'm fine.@k@vS02/01/130101217. ...Please continue...``

Main.TextJPN: 「まぁ、注射器の話はそれだけです。@k@vS02/11/130700475.それだけが個人的に気になったもので」
Main.TextENG: ``Well, that's all I had to say about the syringe.@k@vS02/11/130700475. It was the only thing that personally struck me as interesting.``

Main.TextJPN: ……………梨花ちゃん…。
「…梨花さん、村のマスコットみたいなところがありましたからね。@k@vS02/11/130700477.…今、村は騒然としてるみたいですよ。@k@vS02/11/130700478.…妄信してた年寄り方と殺してしまった園崎家とで」
Main.TextENG: ``...Rika-san was sort of like the village mascot, after all.@k@vS02/11/130700477. ...It looks like the village is in an uproar right now.@k@vS02/11/130700478. ...Between the older blind believers, and the Sonozaki family who killed her.

Main.TextJPN: 「…実効支配していた御三家もほぼ全滅状態」
Main.TextENG: The Three Families' effective control over the village is basically in shambles, too.

Main.TextJPN: 「…………こんなタイミングでまたダムの話が出てきたりしたら、今度こそ間違いなく廃村でしょうなぁ」
Main.TextENG: .........If someone came up to them with talk of a dam again, with this sort of timing, the entire village would be abandoned for sure this time.``

Main.TextJPN: 「………もう俺、…雛見沢とは関係ありませんから」
Main.TextENG: ``......I'm not... related to Hinamizawa anymore.``

Main.TextJPN: 本当は関係なくない。
Main.TextENG: I actually was.

Main.TextJPN: …雛見沢が廃れていく話を聞いて不愉快になるから、…早くこの話を打ち切って欲しくて言っただけだ。
Main.TextENG: ...I just said it because the thought about Hinamizawa being abandoned was unpleasant... and I wanted to end the conversation quickly.

Main.TextJPN: 扉がノックされる。
Main.TextENG: There was a knock at the door.

Main.TextJPN: 細く開き、お袋が、まだ話は続くのかと聞いてきた。
Main.TextENG: It opened slightly, and my mom asked if we were still talking.
``Whoops!@k@vS02/11/130700482. We went off topic, didn't we?@k@vS02/11/130700483. ...What a pickle!``

Main.TextJPN: …………………時計を見る。@k…とっくに５分は過ぎていた。
Main.TextENG: ............I looked at the clock.@k ...Five minutes were long past.

Main.TextJPN: まだ、どうしても聞きたいことがあったので、お袋にもう少しだけと言った。
Main.TextENG: He told my mother that there was something he really wanted to ask, and if she could wait a little bit longer.
``...Is that so?@k@vS02/00/132700036. Keep it short, okay?``

Main.TextJPN: お袋は警察が息子と何を話しているのか、気になって仕方ないようだった。
Main.TextENG: There wasn't any getting around the fact that she was thinking about what a police officer could be talking to her son about.

Main.TextJPN: 「…………日を改めた方が良さそうですねぇ」
Main.TextENG: ``.........Maybe we should choose another day for this.``

Main.TextJPN: 「…あの、…大石さん。@k@vS02/01/130101220.…………魅音は今、…どうしてるんです？」
Main.TextENG: ``...Umm... Ooishi-san.@k@vS02/01/130101220. .........Mion... How is she right now?``

Main.TextJPN: それだけを聞いたら、もう追い返すつもりだ。
Main.TextENG: I wanted to just hear that answer and then get rid of him.

Main.TextJPN: 「…………………それを話す前に、前原さんに一個だけ。@k@vS02/11/130700486.…本当に正直に答えてもらいたいことがあります」
Main.TextENG: ``............Before I tell you that, I just need one thing from you.@k@vS02/11/130700486. ...I just need you to answer something in all honesty.``

Main.TextJPN: 「……何ですか」
Main.TextENG: ``......What is it?``

Main.TextJPN: 「…………………本当に真面目に答えて下さいよ。@k@vS02/11/130700488.…これ、いい加減なこと言っちゃうと、場合によっては捜査撹乱と見られて告発される場合もありますからね」
Main.TextENG: ``...............I want you to take your answer seriously, got it?@k@vS02/11/130700488. ...If you say something indiscreet, it could be viewed as an obstruction of the investigation, and you could be prosecuted.``

Main.TextJPN: …大石さんが、最後の最後で凄む。
Main.TextENG: ...Ooishi-san kept threatening me until the end.

Main.TextJPN: ……一体、何だってんだ。
Main.TextENG: ...What the hell did he want?

Main.TextJPN: 「……前原さん。@k@vS02/11/130700490.…詩音さんを突き落とした犯人は誰だと思います？」
Main.TextENG: ``......Maebara-san.@k@vS02/11/130700490. ...Who do you think the criminal was who pushed Shion from the balcony?``

Main.TextJPN: 「……………………………魅音しか、考えられないじゃないですか」
Main.TextENG: ``............There's no way it could be anyone but Mion, is there?``

Main.TextJPN: 「では、あなたを刺したの、誰です？」
Main.TextENG: ``Then who was the one who stabbed you?``
``............Please don't make me say it again.@k@vS02/01/130101224. ...It was Mion.@k@vS02/01/130101225. ...Mion Sonozaki.``

Main.TextJPN: ……大石さんは苦笑いしながら、汗拭きのハンカチで額をぺたぺたと拭う。
Main.TextENG: ......Ooishi-san smiled bitterly, then dabbed at his forehead with a handkerchief to wipe his sweat.

Main.TextJPN: 予想通りの答えのはずなのに、どこか釈然としない様子が見て取れる。
Main.TextENG: He should have expected that answer, and yet it looked as though he wasn't satisfied with it.

Main.TextJPN: 「詩音を突き落として、俺を刺して。@k@vS02/01/130101227.…魅音の犯行だって、さっき大石さんも認めたじゃないですか」
Main.TextENG: ``She pushed Shion, and stabbed me.@k@vS02/01/130101227. ...Didn't you just admit yourself that Mion was the criminal?``

Main.TextJPN: 「……詩音殺しの犯人が魅音だという根拠は、隣人の男の証言によるものなんです」
Main.TextENG: ``...The evidence we have that Mion killed Shion is based on testimony from the man living next door.``

Main.TextJPN: 「……この隣人ってのは実は暴力団組員、つまり詩音さんのボディーガードだったんですよ。@k@vS02/11/130700494.この内のリーダー格が古参で、園崎姉妹が幼い内から親身になってた男なんだそうで」
Main.TextENG: ``...This neighbor is actually a member of an organized crime group—in other words, he was Shion-san's bodyguard.@k@vS02/11/130700494. It seems he's a veteran leader in that vein, and was like a parent to the Sonozaki sisters growing up.``

Main.TextJPN: …この男はこう証言した。
Main.TextENG: ...That man said this.

Main.TextJPN: 隣の部屋から聞こえてきた騒ぎは、まだ姉妹が同居してた頃によく聞いた姉妹喧嘩の騒ぎにそっくり。@k……いや、間違いなかったと。
Main.TextENG: The noise he heard from next door was just like the sound of a fight between the sisters that he was used to hearing when they still lived together...@k and no, there was no doubt about it.

Main.TextJPN: 魅音と詩音が罵りあう声が聞こえ、取っ組み合いをする大騒ぎが聞こえたと。
Main.TextENG: He said he heard Mion and Shion insulting each other, and heard them struggling.

Main.TextJPN: でも初めは錯乱による幻覚だと思って放っておいた。
Main.TextENG: At first, though, he thought it was a hallucination she was having, brought on by her dementia.

Main.TextJPN: ……このような大騒ぎは、…当時は毎晩あることだったからだ。
Main.TextENG: ...You see, he thought that because that sort of ruckus... had been occurring every night.

Main.TextJPN: だがその晩は…いつになく長いので、鎮静剤を与えようと思い部屋を訪れたのだと言う。
Main.TextENG: However, that night... had been longer than the rest, and he claimed that he went to her room to give her a sedative.

Main.TextJPN: 管理人にカギを持ってこさせるまでの間に騒ぎは収まった。
Main.TextENG: The noise died down while he got the manager to give him the key.

Main.TextJPN: だが一応、様子だけでもと思い、呼び出しに反応がないのを確認の上、開錠に踏み切ったという。
Main.TextENG: He'd already decided he'd at least check up on her, and after she wasn't answering his calls, they took the plunge and unlocked the door.

Main.TextJPN: それで部屋がぐちゃぐちゃ。
Main.TextENG: Then they saw that the room was a mess.

Main.TextJPN: …ベランダの下には詩音が突き落とされていたので、魅音の犯行に違いないと、@k…こうなったらしい。
Main.TextENG: ...Since Shion had been pushed over the balcony, they decided it had to have been Mion...@k and that's how it happened.

Main.TextJPN: 「…つまり、壁越しに聞いたというだけなんです。@k@vS02/11/130700496.しかもこのマンション、組の関係で住人がほとんどいないんです」
Main.TextENG: ``...In other words, he only heard from the other side of the wall.@k@vS02/11/130700496. Plus, because the apartment complex is connected to their organization, it doesn't have many residents.

Main.TextJPN: 「ですからこの騒ぎを聞いてたのも彼らだけ。@k@vS02/11/130700498.……重ねて言えば、園崎魅音を目撃した者は誰一人いないんです」
Main.TextENG: So they were the only ones who heard it happening.@k@vS02/11/130700498. ...To reiterate, there wasn't even one person who witnessed Mion Sonozaki.``

Main.TextJPN: 「見なくったって……そんなの、…魅音の犯行だって、わかるじゃないですか…！」
Main.TextENG: ``Even if he didn't see her... that's... isn't it obviously Mion's doing...?!``

Main.TextJPN: 「まぁまぁ。@k@vS02/11/130700500.…だからつまりですね。@k@vS02/11/130700501.…あなただけがあの晩、確かに園崎魅音を目撃した唯一の人間ってことになるんです。@k@vS02/11/130700502.もう一人の目撃者の詩音さんは生きておられませんからね」
Main.TextENG: ``Now, settle down.@k@vS02/11/130700500. ...This is what I'm saying.@k@vS02/11/130700501. ...It means you are the only one who saw Mion Sonozaki for sure last night.@k@vS02/11/130700502. After all, Shion-san, the other witness, is no longer alive.``

Main.TextJPN: 「…………大石さんが何を言いたいのか、…よくわからないんですけど…」
Main.TextENG: ``............What are you trying to say? ...I don't really understand...``

Main.TextJPN: そこで大石さんは間を置く。
Main.TextENG: At that point, Ooishi-san paused.

Main.TextJPN: 禁煙であることをすっかり忘れて、再びタバコの箱を取り出した。
Main.TextENG: The fact that this was a no-smoking area completely slipped his mind, and he took out his pack of cigarettes again.

Main.TextJPN: カチリと、ライターでタバコに火を付ける。@k……そして紫煙をふーっと吐き出す…。
Main.TextENG: Ker-chack. He lit one with his lighter...@k ...and exhaled a long stream of tobacco smoke...

Main.TextJPN: 「………あなた、本当に園崎魅音に刺されたんですか？」
Main.TextENG: ``......Were you really stabbed by Mion Sonozaki?``
``Yes.@k@vS02/01/130101231. ............There's no doubt about it.``

Main.TextJPN: 大石さんの吐き出す紫煙が、風に流される入道雲のように…流れていく。
Main.TextENG: The smoke Ooishi-san breathed out floated away... like a thundercloud swept away by the wind.

Main.TextJPN: 「…………大石さん、ここ禁煙です。@k@vS02/01/130101233.…看護師さんに怒られますよ」
Main.TextENG: ``.........Ooishi-san, you can't smoke in here.@k@vS02/01/130101233. ...The nurses will get mad.``

Main.TextJPN: 「実は園崎魅音も、…井戸の底から見つかったんですよ」
Main.TextENG: ``Actually... We found Mion Sonozaki at the bottom of the well too.``

Main.TextJPN: 「転落死です。@k@vS02/11/130700507.あの井戸の隠し通路から逃げ出そうとしてハシゴを降りる途中に足を踏み外し、@k@vS02/11/130700508.…底まで転落し、@k@vS02/11/130700509.首の骨を折って死亡したと見られます。@k@vS02/11/130700510.…はい。@k@vS02/11/130700511.詩音さんと同じにね。@k@vS02/11/130700512.首の骨を折って」
Main.TextENG: ``She fell to her death.@k@vS02/11/130700507. We believe that as she was trying to escape to that hidden passage in the well, her foot slipped while climbing down the ladder...@k@vS02/11/130700508. she fell to the bottom,@k@vS02/11/130700509. broke her neck, and died.@k@vS02/11/130700510. ...Yes.@k@vS02/11/130700511. The same way as Shion-san.@k@vS02/11/130700512. She broke her neck.``

Main.TextJPN: 「あの日、前原さんを気絶させた後、園崎魅音は隠し井戸から外へ逃れようとして…。@k@vS02/11/130700514.……足を踏み外して死んだのです」
Main.TextENG: ``After you passed out that day, Mion Sonozaki tried to escape using the hidden well...@k@vS02/11/130700514. ......but her foot slipped and she died.``

Main.TextJPN: 「…まるで、底に突き落とした他の犠牲者の死体に呼び寄せられるようにね」
Main.TextENG: ``...As if beckoned by the corpses of the other sacrifices she dropped down there.``

Main.TextJPN: 「………………………………それじゃ、……おかしいじゃないですか…」
Main.TextENG: ``............... But... That doesn't make any sense, does it...?``

Main.TextJPN: 「検死の結果、間違いなくあの日に死亡したものと確認されました。@k@vS02/11/130700517.…あなたと詩音さんを襲ってからあそこに戻ったんじゃない」
Main.TextENG: ``The autopsy came to the conclusion that she definitely died on that day.@k@vS02/11/130700517. ...She didn't go back there after attacking you and Shion-san.``

Main.TextJPN: 「……あの日にすでに死んでいたんです」
Main.TextENG: ``...She was already dead by then.``

Main.TextJPN: 開いた口が……塞がらない。
Main.TextENG: My jaw... was on the floor.

Main.TextJPN: ……そんなはずは……絶対にない。
Main.TextENG: ...There was absolutely... no way that could be.

Main.TextJPN: ……俺を刺した魅音は、……間違いなく魅音だった。
Main.TextENG: ...Mion was the one that stabbed me... It had to have been her.

Main.TextJPN: ……それ以外の、……誰でもなかったはず…………。
Main.TextENG: ...There wouldn't have been... anyone else to do it.........

Main.TextJPN: 「じゃ、……じゃあ、……だ、誰が俺と詩音を襲ったんですか…！@k@vS02/01/130101238.　誰が…！！」
Main.TextENG: ``Then... then... wh-who attacked Shion and me...?!@k@vS02/01/130101238. Who was it...?!``

Main.TextJPN: 「あなたを襲った、……園崎魅音なのに園崎魅音じゃない、何者かですよ」
Main.TextENG: ``The one who attacked you... was someone who was Mion Sonozaki, and yet not Mion Sonozaki.``

Main.TextJPN: ………すっかり頭の中はぐちゃぐちゃになって、…考えがまとまらなくなる…。
Main.TextENG: ......My mind had become a complete mess... and I was starting to lose my ability to think straight...

Main.TextJPN: 「……鷹野三四さんの死、覚えてますか？」
Main.TextENG: ``...Do you remember how Miyo Takano-san died?``

Main.TextJPN: 「……確か、遠くの山の中で、…焼け死んだって聞いたような…」
Main.TextENG: ......I think I heard that she was... burned to death in some distant mountains...``

Main.TextJPN: 「あれは絞殺された後に焼かれたことがわかってます。@k@vS02/11/130700522.……検死したのは県警さんなんですけどね。@k@vS02/11/130700523.これがちょっとおかしいんですよ」
Main.TextENG: ``We learned that she was burned after being strangled to death.@k@vS02/11/130700522. ...The Gifu station did the autopsy.@k@vS02/11/130700523. It's a little bit strange.

Main.TextJPN: 「……初期の検死結果では死後２４時間経過って出ちゃったんです。@k@vS02/11/130700525.つじつまが合わないってことで、大慌てで当日死亡って改ざんしたらしいんですが」
Main.TextENG: ...The results of the preliminary autopsy said that she had been dead for at least twenty-four hours.@k@vS02/11/130700525. Since that was contradictory, in their panic they seem to have revised it to say she died earlier that day.``

Main.TextJPN: ……魅音のことだけでもぐちゃぐちゃになっているというのに、@k…この上、……まだ何かあると言うのか……。
Main.TextENG: ...Despite me being an absolute wreck over what was going on with Mion...@k he was telling me...... there was even more on top of that......?

Main.TextJPN: …………大石さんが言う、複雑な話が何を言っているのかわからない…。
Main.TextENG: .........I didn't understand the complex things Ooishi-san was telling me...

Main.TextJPN: 「この死後２４時間って検死結果、うちの鑑識のジジイが言うにはですね。@k@vS02/11/130700527.かなり信頼できるものらしいんです。@k@vS02/11/130700528.……つまりどういうことか？」
Main.TextENG: ``The result saying she had been dead for twenty-four hours, as our own old criminologist says...@k@vS02/11/130700527. is pretty damn reliable.@k@vS02/11/130700528. ...So then what would that mean?

Main.TextJPN: 「……これは何度も聞いた質問になりますが、@k@vS02/11/130700530.……あなた綿流しの晩、@k@vS02/11/130700531.…鷹野三四さんに会ってますよねぇ？」
Main.TextENG: ...I've asked that question over and over...@k@vS02/11/130700530. but on the night of Watanagashi...@k@vS02/11/130700531. you were with Miyo Takano-san, weren't you?``

Main.TextJPN: 「………会ってます」
「その前日、お祭りの準備の日にも会ってますよねぇ？@k@vS02/11/130700533.　私もその時お会いしてますし」
Main.TextENG: ``You also met her on the day before, while setting up for the festival, right?@k@vS02/11/130700533. I mean, I ran into her too.``

Main.TextJPN: 「死後２４時間ってことは、…お祭りの前日の晩にはもう死んでるってことになるんですよ」
Main.TextENG: ``If she'd been dead for twenty-four hours... then that would mean she was already dead the day before the festival.``

Main.TextJPN: 「……お祭りの準備の時には生きていた」
Main.TextENG: ``......She was alive during the festival preparations.

Main.TextJPN: 「でも、…あなたたちと一緒に祭具殿に忍び込んだ時、…鷹野さんはもうお亡くなりになっていたのです」
Main.TextENG: However... when you all slipped into the ritual storehouse... Takano-san was already dead.``

Main.TextJPN: 事の発端。@k全ての始まり。
Main.TextENG: The origin of all that happened.@k The beginning of everything.

Main.TextJPN: …何度も後悔することになった、…祭具殿への侵入。
Main.TextENG: ...Our intrusion in the ritual storehouse... which I had come to regret countless times.

Main.TextJPN: それをそそのかした………………………………鷹野さん。
Main.TextENG: The one who tempted me... ...............Takano-san.

Main.TextJPN: 俺たちを、……祭具殿に誘った時にはもう………この世の人では、……なかった…。
Main.TextENG: When she... invited us into the storehouse... she was already... no longer of this world...

Main.TextJPN: 「今回の事件、死人が歩き回り過ぎなんですよ。@k@vS02/11/130700538.…なっはっは…」
Main.TextENG: ``There are too many dead people walking around in this incident.@k@vS02/11/130700538. ...Na-ha-ha...``

Main.TextJPN: …………………死人が引き起こし、……死人が幕を下ろす、…事件。
Main.TextENG: ...............An incident... caused by a dead person... and ended by a dead person.

Main.TextJPN: 「…園崎魅音の死亡時間を、事件当日ではなく、あなたを刺した直後に改ざんせよとの圧力も来てるみたいです。@k@vS02/11/130700540.……この事件をとっとと終わらせようとする外圧でしょうねぇ」
Main.TextENG: ``...Also, apparently they're under pressure to revise the time of Mion Sonozaki's death not to the day of the incident, but to right after she stabbed you...@k@vS02/11/130700540. ...Probably pressure from the outside, to get this incident wrapped up already.``

Main.TextJPN: 「…ですので、今の話はどうか他言無用に願いますよ」
Main.TextENG: ``...So I'd appreciate it if you didn't say a word about this to anyone.``

Main.TextJPN: 大石さんが、椅子にかけていた上着を取るとタバコを靴の裏で消し、漂う煙をぱたぱたと扇いでごまかしだす。
Main.TextENG: Ooishi-san grabbed his jacket that was hanging on the chair, put out his cigarette with the bottom of his foot, and started pretending to wave away the smoke floating around.

Main.TextJPN: 「長居しました」
Main.TextENG: ``I've stayed too long.``

Main.TextJPN: 「…あなたにとっての事件を、せめて終わらせてあげようと思って来たつもりだったんですがね。@k@vS02/11/130700544.……かえって煙に巻いちゃったようで」
Main.TextENG: ``...I had come here thinking I could at least end this incident as it applied to you, but...@k@vS02/11/130700544. ...it looks like it got even more baffling instead.``

Main.TextJPN: 放心したまま、…言葉も返せない俺を尻目に…扉へ歩いていく。
Main.TextENG: Absent-mindedly... he walked towards the door... looking at me, unable to speak, out of the corner of his eye.

Main.TextJPN: 「………もしも、…今後、お話ししたいことが出来たら、いつでもお電話下さい。@k@vS02/11/130700546.さっきのおみやげの中に私の名刺が入ってますんで」
Main.TextENG: ``......If it so happens... that something comes up you want to talk about in the future, call me anytime.@k@vS02/11/130700546. My business card is in those souvenirs from before.

Main.TextJPN: 「…その時はまた素敵なおみやげを持ってお見舞いに来ますよ。@k@vS02/11/130700548.んっふっふっふ！」
Main.TextENG: ...When that time comes, I'll pay you a visit with some wonderful souvenirs again.@k@vS02/11/130700548. Nfu-fu-fu-fu!``

Main.TextJPN: 大石さんは……俺がまだ何か隠してると思ってるみたいだ。
Main.TextENG: Ooishi-san... seemed to think I was still hiding something.

Main.TextJPN: 俺が…この期に及んで、…何を隠してるって…？
Main.TextENG: That I... after all this... would be hiding something...?

Main.TextJPN: 隠されているのは俺の方だ。@k…知りたいのは俺の方だ。
Main.TextENG: I'm the one things are being hidden from.@k ...I'm the one who wants to know.

Main.TextJPN: 「では、またいつかお会いしましょう。@k@vS02/11/130700550.お大事に」
Main.TextENG: ``Then let us meet again one day.@k@vS02/11/130700550. Take care of yourself.``

Main.TextJPN: バタン。
Main.TextENG: Slam.

Main.TextJPN: 廊下を…大石さんがコツコツと…歩み去っていく音を聞きながら。@k…なおも放心状態から戻れないでいる。
Main.TextENG: I listened... to the tap tap tap... of Ooishi-san walking down the hallway.@k ...I still couldn't return from my state of bewilderment.

Main.TextJPN: 俺にとっての事件を終わらせようと思って…？
Main.TextENG: He wanted to end this incident as it applied to me...?

Main.TextJPN: 何が終わりなものか。
Main.TextENG: What was over?

Main.TextJPN: 何も終わってなんかいない。
Main.TextENG: Nothing was over.

Main.TextJPN: …事件は…まだまだ…続いている…。
Main.TextENG: ...The incident... was still... continuing...

Main.TextJPN: ………その時、ぬぅっと、…鮮血をこびり付かせた腕が、…ベッドの下から生えてきた。
Main.TextENG: ......Then, slip... an arm covered in fresh blood... came out from underneath the bed.

Main.TextJPN: …そんなには驚かない。
Main.TextENG: ...I wasn't that surprised.

Main.TextJPN: ……これは、…恐怖に囚われた俺が見ている幻……。
Main.TextENG: ...This was... an illusion I was seeing, seized with fear...

Main.TextJPN: ……圭チャン、……ダカラ言ッタデショウ……。
Main.TextENG: ...Kei-chan... I told you, remember...

Main.TextJPN: ベッドの下から、…しわがれた声が聞こえる。@k……それでも魅音の声だとわかった。
Main.TextENG: I heard a... guttural voice coming from under the bed.@k ...I still recognized it as Mion's voice.
``...What, Mion?@k@vS02/01/130101248. ......What did you tell me...?``

Main.TextJPN: ……私、……アノ日ニ警告シタヨ…。
Main.TextENG: ...I... warned you on that day...

Main.TextJPN: ……今日以降、……私ノ姿ヲ見タトシテモ……@rソレハ私ノ屍ニ取リ憑イタ……鬼ナンダヨッテ………。
Main.TextENG: ...After today... if you see me...... it will be the demon... that has possessed my body......

Main.TextJPN: 「……あはははは、……そうだな、……言ってたよな。@k@vS02/01/130101250.……ごめん。@k@vS02/01/130101251.…ちょっと注意が足らなかったな。@k@vS02/01/130101252.……だから刺されちゃったんだな。@k@vS02/01/130101253.…あははははは……」
Main.TextENG: ``...Ahahaha... You did... You said that, didn't you?@k@vS02/01/130101250. ......Sorry.@k@vS02/01/130101251. ...Guess I wasn't careful enough.@k@vS02/01/130101252. ......That's why I got stabbed.@k@vS02/01/130101253. ...Ahahahaha...``

Main.TextJPN: ハシゴから落ちた時に怪我をしたのか、@k…何本かの指の爪は…ばっくりと開いて剥けかけていた…。
Main.TextENG: Possibly wounds sustained when she fell from the ladder...@k many of her fingernails... were broken and torn...

Main.TextJPN: その腕が…ゆっくりとベッドの上をまさぐり、…俺の腕を探す。
Main.TextENG: Her arm... slowly felt about on top of the bed... searching for mine.
``Oh... hey... Mion.@k@vS02/01/130101255. ...I... just, well, thought of a good joke.@k@vS02/01/130101256. ...Want to hear it?``

Main.TextJPN: ……………………………ベッドの下の魅音は、答えない。
Main.TextENG: ............The Mion under the bed didn't answer.

Main.TextJPN: 「た…たとえばさ、………俺が今日、……ここで死んじゃうんだよ。@k@vS02/01/130101258.……だけども、…明日以降もここにいて、普通に生活して見せるんだよ」
Main.TextENG: ``L-Let's say...... ......that I... died here today...@k@vS02/01/130101258. ...but... tomorrow, I'd still be here, living a normal life.``

Main.TextJPN: 「……で、……あとでそれが大石のヤツにわかって、…またしても、死亡日時が合わない。@k@vS02/01/130101260.死んだはずの人間が生活していた…って言って泡を食って大騒ぎするんだよ…。@k@vS02/01/130101261.鷹野さんに魅音、そして俺で３人目」
Main.TextENG: ``......So...... when Ooishi-san learned about it afterwards... the time of death wouldn't make sense, once again!@k@vS02/01/130101260. He'd make a huge deal about how someone who should have died was alive... and he'd totally lose his head!@k@vS02/01/130101261. Takano-san, then Mion, and then me third.``
``...So?!@k@vS02/01/130101263. Funny, right?@k@vS02/01/130101264. Makes you laugh, doesn't it?@k@vS02/01/130101265. Hahahahahahahahahahahaha...!``

Main.TextJPN: 「…笑えよ。@k@vS02/01/130101267.…それとも、あ、あんまり面白くなかったか…？」
Main.TextENG: ``...Laugh.@k@vS02/01/130101267. ...Or was it n-not that funny...?``

Main.TextJPN: 魅音の血塗れの手が……俺の手首を…探り当てる。
Main.TextENG: Mion's bloodstained hand... groped around... and found my wrist.

Main.TextJPN: そして、爪の剥がれた指だけど、…爪を立てるように…ぎゅうっと握り締めて……、
Main.TextENG: Though her fingernails were torn... she gripped it hard... as if scratching me......

Main.TextJPN: 「い、…いてててて、……か、加減しろよ……、いた、…痛いって…、」
Main.TextENG: ``Ow... ow, ow... G-Go easy...... Ow... It hurts...``

Main.TextJPN: ……圭チャン、………………迎エニ来タヨ………。
Main.TextENG: ...Kei-chan................ I've come for you......

Main.TextJPN: 手首を振りほどこうにも…信じられないくらいの力で締め付けられ、振りほどくことができない。
Main.TextENG: I tried to shake my wrist loose... but the strength she held it with was unbelievable, and I couldn't.

Main.TextJPN: 握られているのは片方の手首だけのはずなのに…なぜか全身が動かない。
Main.TextENG: She was only gripping one wrist... and yet my whole body wouldn't move.

Main.TextJPN: …ぴくりとも動けない。
Main.TextENG: ...I couldn't even twitch.

Main.TextJPN: 指先は開き、…握り拳を作ることもできない……。
Main.TextENG: My fingers were spread apart... and I couldn't make a fist, either......

Main.TextJPN: ………あの、……握り拳を作ることすら許さない…拘束台の記憶が蘇る………………！
Main.TextENG: .........And that...... fact that I couldn't make a fist... reminded me of the restraining table..............

Main.TextJPN: 眩い光。まるで手術台の上に固定され、眩しい光を当てられているかのよう！

Main.TextENG: I felt... a crooked nail press against my left pinky fingertip.

Main.TextJPN: 左手の小指の先端に、…歪な釘の手触り。
Main.TextENG: ...Mion's forehead was split open... and with a face covered with blood... she smiled...

Main.TextJPN: …額を割った魅音が…血をこびり付かせた顔で…にやりと笑いながら…、鼻がぶつかるくらいの…目の前に…。
Main.TextENG: And got right up... just behind me...

Main.TextJPN: ……何も終わってない。……何も終わってない。
Main.TextENG: ......Nothing was over. ......Nothing was over.

Main.TextJPN: この事件は何も終わってなんかない。
Main.TextENG: This incident was far from being over.

Main.TextJPN: …まだ続いてる。
Main.TextENG: ...It was still going on.

Main.TextJPN: まだまだ続いてる。
Main.TextENG: It was still happening.

Main.TextJPN: 誰かこの事件を終わらせてください。
Main.TextENG: Someone, please end this incident.

Main.TextJPN: この残酷で無惨で気の毒で悲しい、@r……この事件を終わらせてください。
Main.TextENG: This cruel, tragic, unfortunate, sad incident...@rPlease, end it.

Main.TextJPN: それだけが……俺の望みです…
Main.TextENG: That... is my only wish...

Main.TextJPN: 「あの時、一つかなえてあげたでしょ？@k@vS02/03/130300752.　今度はダメぇ。@k@vS02/03/130300753.……あっはははははははははははははははははははははははははははははははははははははははははははは！！！」
Main.TextENG: ``I granted you one before, remember?@k@vS02/03/130300752. You don't get any more.@k@vS02/03/130300753. ......Ah-hahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha!!!``

Main.TextJPN: 魅音が、俺の小指の先端に当てられた釘をぐっと押さえつけた。
Main.TextENG: Mion firmly held the nail down on my fingertip.

Main.TextJPN: …もう片手に握られた金槌がゆっくり大きく振り上げられ……………………、
Main.TextENG: ...And, with her other hand, she slowly swung a mallet up into the air, and.................
